business.headline: Satya Nadella bets big on AI, names Judson Althoff to lead Microsoft commercial unitMicrosoft has elevated Chief Commercial Officer Judson Althoff as CEO of its commercial business, allowing Satya Nadella to focus on AI, datacenter buildout, and product innovation.
Why the price of gold keeps breaking recordsBullion has soared more than 45% this year, putting it on track for the biggest annual gain since 1979.

Adar Poonawalla in talks to buy RCB stake? United Spirits shares updateThe CEO of Serum Institute, Adar Poonawalla, is in talks with Diageo to purchase a stake in RCB, one of the Indian Premier League's top teams.
Are festive cheer and auto stocks driving the market rally?The stock market showed renewed strength, as festive season cheer and gains in auto stocks lifted investor sentiment across sectors.

DA hiked to 58%: What it means for government employees' salary and pensionThe Union Cabinet approved the proposal to increase the DA for central government employees and Dearness Relief (DR) for pensioners by 3%. With this revision, the DA rate now stands at 58%.
Sensex ends 716 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; Tata Motors up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 715.64 points to end at 80,983.31, while the NSE Nifty50 added 225.20 points to close at 24,836.30.

This Indian gold lender holds 3 times the gold of PakistanThe country's largest gold loan provider, currently holds 209 tonnes of gold in its safe deposit boxes. This is three times the gold reserves of Pakistan and higher than the reserves of Brazil, Australia, and South Africa.

Shah Rukh Khan joins billionaire club, Mukesh Ambani tops Hurun India Rich ListMukesh Ambani has reclaimed the top spot on the Hurun India Rich List 2025, while Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan joins the billionaire club for the first time.

Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why markets are rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex surged 660.64 points to 80,928.26, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 185.70 points to 24,796.80 as of 12:10 PM. The rally was broad-based on Dalal Street.

Union Cabinet approves 3% DA hike for central government employeesEarlier this year, the government had approved a 2% increase in DA in March, raising it from 53% to 55% of the basic salary and pension.

RBI announces big push for business reforms and easier lending. Details hereThe Reserve Bank of India has unveiled a set of measures aimed at making it easier for businesses to operate and improving access to loans. The reforms are expected to help companies, exporters, and banks alike.

RBI holds repo rate at 5.5%: How it impacts your EMIsBy keeping the repo rate unchanged at 5.5%, the RBI has signalled stability for borrowers. Home loan EMIs are likely to stay where they are, offering some relief to existing and new buyers.

RBI holds lending rate steady at 5.5%, maintains neutral stanceThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the key repo rate unchanged at 5.5% as the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), led by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, concluded its three-day meeting. The central bank also maintained its neutral stance.

LG Electronics India IPO opens next week: 5 key details investors must knowLG Electronics is set to launch the third-largest IPO of 2025, after Tata Capital's Rs 15,500 crore issue scheduled between October 6 and October 8, and HDB Financial Services, which raised Rs 12,500 crore in June this year.
Sensex opens nearly 100 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; Sun Pharma up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 58.51 points to 80,326.13, while the NSE NIfty50 added 25.65 points to 24,636.75 as of 9:24 am.

RBI MPC decision today: Will there be a surprise rate cut?India has seen supportive fiscal measures this year, including changes in income tax slabs and GST cuts, which are expected to boost consumption during the festive season.

Government keeps PPF, NSC and other small savings rates unchanged. Check hereThe government has kept interest rates unchanged for key small savings schemes, including PPF and NSC, for the upcoming quarter.

LG Electronics India's Rs 15,000 crore IPO to open on October 7. Check detailsThe much-anticipated IPO of LG Electronics India, worth Rs 15,000 crore, is scheduled to open on October 7. Here's everything you need to know.

Behind the buffet: How restaurants profit from all-you-can-eat deals'All you can eat.' That is how buffets work. But then how do famous buffets such as BBQ Nation, The GT Road, and Pirates of Grill, with prices ranging from Rs 900-1400, make a profit serving unlimited food?

Gold and silver lead the way as investors seek stability, says expertWith stock market volatility unsettling investors, many are turning to gold and silver for safety. Experts say the renewed interest in precious metals reflects a broader search for stability amid uncertain conditions.
Sensex, Nifty fall for 8th day in a row ahead of RBI MPC decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 97.32 points to close at 80,267.62, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 23.80 points to end at 24,611.10.

Why staying consistent matters more than timing the market, says expertWhile market swings grab attention, experts insist that consistent investing, rather than trying to predict peaks and dips, is what helps investors achieve reliable growth over time.

Is Zoho made in India? Founder Sridhar Vembu answersSridhar Vembu, founder and former CEO of Zoho Corporation, has addressed concerns about where Zoho products are developed, where user data is stored, and the pricing of its messaging service, Arattai.

5 reasons why gold hit a record high today. Should you buy?Today, gold touched a historic high, fuelled by global uncertainty and market trends. We break down five key factors behind the rise, and whether it's a smart buy.

TCS shares slide as uncertainty grows over job cuts, staff report fluidity listTCS stock has fallen 4.65% in the past five days and 6.72% in the past month. Over the past year, it has lost nearly a third of its value, with reports of large-scale layoffs creating fresh panic among employees.

Will Post Office Savings Schemes like PPF and NSC witness a rate cut?With the Finance Ministry set to review small savings rates at the end of September, many investors are wondering if schemes like PPF and NSC will see a cut. The RBI's recent repo rate reductions have only added to the speculation.

Where to invest in PSU banks and NBFCs? Analysts pick top stocksPSU banks remain one of the most attractive options in the current market. With the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) scheduled to meet soon, market watchers are keeping a close eye on any rate-related decisions

New RBI proposals to make borrowing easier, tighten credit checksAnnounced through seven directions and circulars on September 29, 2025, three of these changes will take effect from October 1, while four others have been released for public consultation until October 20, 2025.
Sensex jumps 250 points, Nifty above 24,500; BEL gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 299.85 points to 80,664.79, while the NSE Nifty50 added 71 points to 24,705.90 as of 9:24 am.

Tata Capital vs WeWork India: Which IPO should you invest in?Two names drawing strong attention this week are Tata Capital Ltd and WeWork India Management Ltd, both preparing to make their market debuts in October 2025.

RBI simplifies process for claim settlement of deceased account holdersThe new framework by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has been introduced to remove the confusion caused by different practices followed by banks earlier.

When will the 8th Pay Commission be implemented? Here's what you should knowThe Pay Commission affects much more than basic salaries. It influences allowances, pensions, and long-term financial security. In times of rising inflation, employees and pensioners are especially keen for the Commission's work to begin.

From CEOs to ministers, support pours in for Zoho's ArattaiThe rise of Arattai has caught the attention of users, industry leaders, and public figures, many of whom have shared their support and congratulations for Zoho and its founder, Sridhar Vembu.

Who should invest in Tata Capital IPO? Market expert weighs inThe Tata Capital IPO is around the corner, and many investors are wondering whether it's the right bet. A market expert has broken down who should consider subscribing and who may want to stay cautious.

Sensex, Nifty close flat as investors turn cautious over US-India trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 61.52 points lower to end at 80,364.94, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 19.80 points to close at 24,634.90.

Moody's keeps India's Baa3 rating unchanged with stable outlookMoody's said India's strengths include its large and fast-growing economy, a sound external position, and a stable domestic financing base for fiscal deficits.

Beyond metros: How festive cheer boosts real estate demand in Tier-2 citiesWhile metros grab most of the headlines, smaller cities are quietly stealing the show. With festivals around the corner, Tier-2 cities are witnessing a strong spike in property interest and sales.

Lufthansa layoffs: German airline plans 4,000 job cuts over next 5 yearsThe job cuts will mainly affect administrative roles rather than operational positions such as pilots, cabin crew or ground staff.

Does EPFO's new ECR system simplify return filing for employers?The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has launched a revamped electronic challan-cum-return (ECR) system, aiming to make return filing easier and more accurate for employers. But does it really simplify the process?

Will RBI announce a rate cut in the upcoming MPC meeting? Here's what to expectThe Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee begins its three-day meeting to decide whether it is time to cut interest rates or hold steady. With inflation easing and growth signals mixed, all eyes are on what the central bank does next.

Frankenstein trailer: Creature Jacob Elordi unleashes rage on creator Oscar Issac The trailer of director Guillermo del Toro's 'Frankenstein' was released by Netflix on October 1, 2025. The film features Oscar Isaac and Jacob Elordi and reimagines Mary Shelley's classic tale with a modern twist.

Priya Marathe's husband Shantanu shares heartfelt note a month after her death Actor Shantanu Moghe posted an emotional message marking a month since Priya Marathe's death. Priya Marathe, known for 'Pavitra Rishta', died after battling cancer.

Allu Arjun's brother Allu Sirish announces engagement to Nayanika in October Actor Allu Sirish announced his engagement to Nayanika on October 1, the birth anniversary of his grandfather, actor Allu Ramalingaiah. His brother Allu Arjun, shared a congratulatory post on social media.

Which Marvel actor stars in Jason Statham's The Beekeeper 2? Find out here Apart from new additions to the cast, Jason Statham's The Beekeeper 2 will bring back Jeremy Irons, Jemma Redgrave and Emmy Raver-Lampman in familiar roles from the first film

Sunny Sanskari vs Kantara Chapter 1: Varun-Janhvi film trails in advance booking 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' is set for a Rs 2 crore opening. The film faces stiff competition from actor-director Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' at the box office.

Bigg Boss 19 leads OTT non-fiction with 7.5 million weekly views 'Bigg Boss 19', hosted by Salman Khan, became the most watched reality show on OTT for the week of September 22-28, 2025, with 7.5 million views. The second most-watched on the list was 'Rise & Fall'.

KBC 17: Contestant quits at Rs 1 crore question, can you answer it? Kaun Banega Crorepati 17 contestant Kailash Rambhau Kuntewad won Rs 50 lakh after quitting the Rs 1 crore question on Amitabh Bachchan's quiz show.

They Call Him OG: Pawan Kalyan's film adds a new Neha Shetty dance track Neha Shetty's dance track 'Kiss Kiss Bang Bang' has been added to 'They Call Him OG' from Tuesday evening shows. The move aims to boost theatre footfall during Dasara after ticket price normalisation.

Explained: Taj Mahal controversy reignited by The Taj Story poster row Taj Mahal's origins spark fresh debate after Paresh Rawal's 'The Taj Story' poster depicts a Shiva idol inside the monument. Here's why the poster is raising storm.

Song Kang completes military service, to star in musical drama Four Hands South Korean actor Song Kang was discharged from military service on October 1, 2025. He is reviewing an offer for the lead in the upcoming drama 'Four Hands'.

Farah Khan reacts hilariously to viral reel calling her films brainrot core Filmmaker Farah Khan reacted with humour to a viral reel calling her films 'Om Shanti Om', 'Happy New Year', and 'Tees Maar Khan' "brain rot core," asking, "Is brain rot a compliment??"

Balika se vadhu tak: Avika Gor shares pics from wedding with Milind Chandwani Actor Avika Gor recently shared pictures from her wedding with Milind Chandwani. The couple got married on the 'Pati Patni Aur Panga' sets.

Rani Mukerji on Deepika's 8-hour rule: Worked 6–7 hours while breastfeeding Adira Actor Rani Mukerji recently weighed in on the 8-hour working shift and explained how such things can be sorted out with proper conversation. Mukerji also recalled her motherhood experience with daughter Adira.

Kantara Chapter 1: How much did Rishab Shetty's film earn through advance booking? Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1' has collected over Rs 11 crore (without block seats) in advance bookings ahead of its October 2 release. The film's strong regional appeal highlights growing interest in historical narratives from coastal Karnataka.

Bridgerton Season 4 first look out, hints at masquerade and new leading lady The first poster for 'Bridgerton' Season 4 has been unveiled. It teases a grand masquerade and introduces Yerin Ha as Sophie Baek. The new season, set to premiere in 2026, promises romance, secrets, and drama at the heart of the beloved period saga.

The film has the right messaging, but melodrama and predictability weigh it down.

general news.headline: Trump to meet Xi in four weeks, promises aid to US farmers amid tariff warDonald Trump said he will meet Xi Jinping in four weeks, with soybeans set to be a major topic. Trump accused China of halting purchases for negotiating reasons and vowed tariff revenues would support US farmers.

The actions aim to prevent further incidents and address public health concerns.

Did Trump, Netanyahu trick Muslim countries on Gaza peace plan?The Gaza peace deal presented to Hamas is significantly different from the one on which the US and Muslim countries agreed on earlier. Israeli President Netanyahu managed to secure "significant 11th-hour changes". Hamas is seeking changes in clauses, while Qatar wants discussions on the details of the deal amid outrage across the Ummah.

Where is the Asia Cup trophy after Pak's Mohsin Naqvi fled with it?Mohsin Naqvi, the president of the Asian Cricket Council, fled with the Asia Cup trophy after team India refused to accept it from a Pakistani minister. It has been three days since the Indian cricket team clinched the title of Asian champions, but where is the trophy?

PM unveils Rs 100 coin at RSS event, Bharat Mata features on currency for 1st timeThe Rs 100 coin features the national emblem on one side, while the other side depicts a majestic image of Bharat Mata in Varada Mudra, a gesture of offering with the palm outward, accompanied by a lion.

Israeli military diverts Gaza aid flotilla vessels with Greta Thunberg aboardThe Israeli foreign ministry shared a post on X saying Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg and other passengers were "safe and healthy," alongside a video that appeared to show Thunberg with masked and armed Israeli personnel.

Trump offers protection to energy-rich Qatar, says attack on Doha a threat to USThe order highlights the "close cooperation" and "shared interest" between the US and Qatar, vowing to "guarantee the security and territorial integrity of the state of Qatar against external attack".

The curious case of Ladakh's 'pregnancy tourism'The concept of pregnancy tourism takes a complete U-turn when you head deep into Ladakh's Aryan Valley, where the narrative around the phenomenon has little to do with a better life or social benefits. Here, the story is tangled up in myth, folklore, and a lingering obsession with "racial purity."

With wet weather forecast, the conditions in Ahmedabad may not be straightforward.

Who's Tauqeer Raza, the mastermind of 'I Love Muhammad' chaos in Bareilly?UP cleric Maulana Tauqeer Raza Khan, a descendant of Ala Hazrat, the founder of the Barelvi Sunni order, has long been both a kingmaker and a troublemaker in Bareilly and the Rohilkhand region. He is allegedly the mastermind of the 'I Love Muhammad' protests that turned violent in Bareilly. So, who is this controversial cleric?

Married, but no connection: Reality of silent divorces in Indian homesSilent divorce is the reality of many Indian households. On paper and in society's eyes, couples remain married, but behind closed doors there is no emotional or physical connection. Rarely acknowledged, this situation often leaves people bitter, fuels mental health struggles, and has long-term consequences for children.

Traitors to Ummah: Pak, Arab nations face outrage for backing Trump's Gaza planLeaders of Pakistan and Arab-Muslim nations are facing a massive backlash after endorsing US President Donald Trump's Gaza peace plan. It has been branded as a "betrayal of the Palestinian cause" for recognising Israel. Leaders, including Shehbaz Sharif, are being called "traitors to the Ummah".

Karur stampede: Why is BJP going soft on Vijay?With assembly elections due next year, the BJP is desperate to avoid being pushed to the margins in Tamil Nadu. Annamalai wants to project the party as an assertive opposition that holds the DMK to account. At the same time, it cannot afford to cross swords with Vijay.

Wah Trump ji wah! Opportunity that India shouldn't missAs US President Donald Trump pitches a Gaza peace plan in his bid for a Nobel Peace Prize, world leaders have rushed to applaud. India has lauded Trump's peace bid with PM Narendra Modi's message translated into seven world languages. This comes amid a low point in Indo-US ties. Trump has presented an opportunity and India must resort to realpolitik.

Pakistani-origin grooming gang leader, 6 others jailed for raping minors in UKA Pakistani-origin man has been sentenced to 35 years in prison for leading a Rochdale grooming gang that raped two 13-year-old schoolgirls between 2001 and 2006. Six other Pakistani-origin men received 12 to 29 years behind bars. Zahid lured victims with gifts from his market stall and demanded sexual favours from them.

Netanyahu's apology to Qatar, phone on Trump's lap: A telling White House photoThe call, made on Monday from the Oval Office, came days after an Israeli strike in Doha killed five people, including the son of a Hamas leader. Roston Chase's West Indies side arrives in India for a two-match Test series at a time when India, under Shubman Gill, appear more vulnerable at home than they have in years. NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
